questions.text: The next two questions relate to the circuit represented by the electric potential graph below. What is the resistance of the resistor represented by downhill A?
What is the resistance of the resistor represented by the downhill at point B?
The next three questions relate to the circuit represented by the electric potential graph pictured below. What is the resistance of resistor A?
What is the resistance of resistor B?
An identical current flows through resistors C and D. What is the resistance of each resistor?

answerChoices.text: They both have a resistance of 2 Ω.
They both have a resistance of 1 Ω.
They both have a resistance of 3 Ω.
They both have a resistance of 4 Ω.
One has a resistance of 1 Ω. The other has a resistance of 2 Ω.
One has a resistance of 1 Ω. The other has a resistance of 3 Ω.
One has a resistance of 2 Ω. The other has a resistance of 4 Ω.
One has a resistance of 3 Ω. The other has a resistance of 4 Ω.
There is not enough information given to answer the question.
